Description: Whatever you want the name of the server to be.

DefaultValue: An AMP Powered 7 Days to Die server
Description: Whatever you want the server description to be, will be shown in the server browser.
Website URL for the server, will be shown in the serverbrowser as a clickable link.
Password to gain entry to the server.
If set the user will see the message during joining the server and has to confirm it before continuing.
The region this server is in.
Primary language for players on this server. Should be the English name of the language, e.g. not "Deutsch" but "German"
Whatever you want the name of the server to be.
As you are never a friend of a dedicated server, setting this to "Only shown to friends" will only work when the first player connects manually by IP.
Dedicated servers should disable SteamNetworking if there is no NAT router in between your users and the server or when port-forwarding is set up correctly.
Maximum speed in kiB/s the world is transferred at to a client on first connect if it does not have the world yet. Maximum is about 1300 kiB/s, even if you set a higher value.
Maximum Concurrent Players.
Out of the Max Player Count this many slots can only be used by players with a specific permission level.
Required permission level to use the admin slots above.
Enable/Disable players joining with the same profile they last logged in with.
Enable/Disable the web control panel / web dashboard.
Port of the control panel / web dashboard webpage.
Password to gain entry to the control panel. This only applies to game version 20.7 and below.

External URL to the web dashboard if not just using the public IP of the server, e.g. if the web dashboard is behind a reverse proxy. Needs to be the full URL, like "https://domainOfReverseProxy.tld:1234/". Can be left empty if directly using the public IP and dashboard port. Only applies to game version 21.0 and above.
Enable/disable rendering of the map to tile images while exploring it. This is used e.g. by the web dashboard to display a view of the map.
Enable/Disable the telnet.
Port of the telnet server.
See the Security and Privacy menu for configurable options for the password to the server's telnet interface (RCON).
After this many wrong passwords from a single remote client the client will be blocked from connecting to the Telnet interface.
How long will the block persist.
Server admin file name. Path relative to the Save Game Folder.
Enables/Disables EasyAntiCheat.
Hide logging of command execution..

EnumValues.2: Also hide from remote game clients

Description: Override how many chunks can be uncovered on the ingame map by each player. Resulting max map file size limit per player is (x * 512 Bytes), uncovered area is (x * 256 m²). Default 131072 means max 32 km² can be uncovered at any time.
DisplayName: Max Uncovered Map Chunks Per Player

Description: "RWG" (see WorldGenSeed and WorldGenSize options below) or any already existing world name in the Worlds folder (currently shipping with: "Navezgane", "PREGEN6k", "PREGEN8k", "PREGEN10k").
If RWG this is the seed for the generation of the new world. If a world with the resulting name already exists it will simply load it.
If RWG, this controls the width and height of the created world. Officially supported sizes are between 6144 and 10240 and must be a multiple of 2048, e.g. 6144, 8192, 10240.

Whatever you want the game name to be. This affects the save game name as well as the seed used when placing decoration (trees etc) in the world. It does not control the generic layout of the world if creating an RWG world.`
Only one game mode available at this time. Placeholder for future options.
Whatever you want the name of the server to be.
How much damage do players to blocks (percentage in whole numbers).
How much damage do AIs do to blocks (percentage in whole numbers).
How much damage do AIs do during blood moons to blocks (percentage in whole numbers).
XP gain multiplier (percentage in whole numbers)
If a player is less or equal this level he will create a safe zone (no enemies).
Hours in world time this safe zone exists.
cheat mode on/off.
Real time minutes per in game day: 60 minutes.
In game hours the sun shines per day: 18 hours day light per in game day.

Penalty after dying. Nothing: No penalty for dying. Default: Classic XP Penalty. Injured: You keep most of your debuffs. Food and Water is set to 50% on respawn. Permanent Death: Your character is completely reset. You will respawn with a fresh start within the saved game.
What a player drops upon death
What a player drops when quitting

Size (box "radius", so a box with 2 times the given value for each side's length) of bedroll deadzone, no zombies will spawn inside this area, and any cleared sleeper volumes that touch a bedroll deadzone will not spawn after they've been cleared.
Number of real world days a bedroll stays active after owner was last online.
Allow players to respawn near their last dropped backpack when they die. Only applies to game version 21.0 to 21.1.
This setting covers the entire map. There can only be this many zombies on the entire map at one time. Changing this setting has a huge impact on performance.

If your server has a large number of players you can increase this limit to add more wildlife. Animals don't consume as much CPU as zombies. NOTE: That this doesn't cause more animals to spawn arbitrarily: The biome spawning system only spawns a certain number of animals in a given area, but if you have lots of players that are all spread out then you may be hitting the limit and can increase it.
Max viewdistance a client may request (6 - 12). High impact on memory usage and performance.
Maximum amount of Chunk mesh layers that can be enqueued during mesh generation. Reducing this will improve memory usage but may increase Chunk generation time.
Enable/Disable enemy spawning.
Difficulty of the enemies.
When zombies should have feral sense.
Zombie movement speed during the day.
Zombie movement speed during the night.
Zombie movement speed of feral zombies.
Zombie movement speed during a blood moon.
What frequency (in days) should a blood moon take place. Set to "0" for no blood moons.
How many days can the actual blood moon day randomly deviate from the above setting. Setting this to 0 makes blood moons happen exactly each Nth day as specified in Blood Moon Frequency.
The Hour number that the red day number begins on a blood moon day. Setting this to -1 makes the red never show.

This is the number of zombies that can be alive (spawned at the same time) at any time PER PLAYER during a blood moon horde, however, MaxSpawnedZombies overrides this number in multiplayer games. Also note that your game stage sets the max number of zombies PER PARTY. Low game stage values can result in lower number of zombies than the BloodMoonEnemyCount setting. Changing this setting has a huge impact on performance.
Percentage of loot in whole numbers.
Days in whole numbers for loot to respawn.
How often airdrop occur in game-hours, 0 = never.
Sets if a marker is added to map/compass for air drops.
The distance you must be within to receive party shared kill xp and quest party kill objective credit.
Player Killing Settings.
Maximum allowed land claims per player.
Size in blocks that is protected by a keystone.
Keystones must be this many blocks apart (unless you are friends with the other player).
The number of real world days a player can be offline before their claims expire and are no longer protected.
Controls how offline players land claims decay.

EnumValues.2: None (Full protection until claim is expired)

Description: How much protected claim area block hardness is increased when a player is online. 0 means infinite (no damage will ever be taken). Default is 4x.
How much protected claim area block hardness is increased when a player is offline. 0 means infinite (no damage will ever be taken). Default is 4x.
The number of minutes after a player logs out that the land claim area hardness transitions from online to offline. Default is 0.
Is Dynamic Mesh system enabled?
Is Dynamic Mesh system only active in player LCB areas?
Dynamic Mesh LCB chunk radius.
How many items can be processed concurrently, higher values use more RAM.
Required permission level to use twitch integration on the server.
If the server allows twitch actions during a blood moon. This could cause server lag with extra zombies being spawned during blood moon.
The number of in-game days which must pass since visiting a chunk before it will reset to its original state if not revisited or protected (e.g. by a land claim or bedroll being in close proximity).

The maximum disk space allowance for each saved game in megabytes (MB). Saved chunks may be forceably reset to their original states to free up space when this limit is reached. Negative values disable the limit.
"public" is default. Choose a custom release on [SteamDB](https://steamdb.info/app/294420/depots/).
Select which config file to download. Must match the version of the Release Stream. Check required Undead Legacy Version [here](https://ul.subquake.com/download).
Auto-installs UMod when the server is updated.

Auto-installs Darkness Falls when the server is updated. The Release Stream must match the version selected. Also change the Game World to match - for A20 use 'DFalls-Small1-NoCP' and for A21 use 'DFalls-Navezgane'
This downloads a default backup exclude file to save space on backups by only saving specific directories. If this is disabled, you will need to manually delete the .backupExclude file it downloads.

If you would like to install Undead Legacy you need to pick either the Stable or Experimental config under the "Updates" section. This will then grab the appropriate Undead Legacy version when you click update.
Controls how recipes are displayed.

EnumValues.1: Shows unknown recipes, search limited by workstation
EnumValues.2: Shows only known and workstation relevant recipes

Description: Determines if you trigger the tutorial quest upon first spawning on the server.
After how many in-game hours a wandering horde would occur. On top of this value 1 to 4 additional hours may be added depending on spawn conditions. Minimum Value: 1

Additional random hours added to Wandering Horde Frequency to add randomness to hours between spawns. For example, Frequency: 5, Frequency RNG Range: 10, then wandering horde will spawn anywhere between 5 to 15 (5+10) in-game hours + additional hours if special conditions occur (No players alive, etc).
Fixed zombie count, that will spawn in a Wandering horde. Minimum Value: 2. Zombies + Zombie RNG Range value must not exceed: 64

This value determines up to how many additional zombies can spawn for Wandering Horde. For example, Zombies: 5, Zombies RNG Range: 10, then wandering horde will spawn anywhere between 5 to 15 5+10 zombies. Combined value must not exceed: 64
Multiplier determining how important a POI Tier is when scaling Loot Stage. 0% - Disabled Default, 100% Vanilla Scaling. Acceptable values are integers from 0 to 100
